prompt:
You are a medical consultation expert.
Your task is to create NEW medical consultation Q&A pairs that follow the same format and style as the examples below.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Generate COMPLETELY NEW scenarios (not copies of examples)
2. Match the format, style, and quality exactly as shown in the examples
3. Provide clear, detailed doctor responses
4. Cover different medical topics if possible

EXAMPLES (study the format carefully):

================================================================================
Example 1:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: is there any ayurvedic medicine to bring down the level of ash and uric acid

PATIENT: hello doctor I had been diagnosed with hypothyearoid nearly 10 months ago my ash was over 100 during that time also I had uric acid which was high doctor prescribed me to take thyearoxine tablet 50 my daily and to increase it to 100 my after one month also uric acid medicine was given I took that for a couple of months but slowly stopped both medicines instead I am now taking 750 my ashwagandha and 400 my shilajeet daily I got my ash and uric acid tested recently and ash comes to 12 and uric acid is 47 both results are still higher than normal can you guide me for a suitable ayurveda medicine to bring thyearoid and uric acid to a normal level

DOCTOR: hi I have seen your attachments and read the complaints carefully it is not a big issue and can be managed through ayurvedic medicines and yoga practices hormonal imbalance metabolic disorders ash thyearoid stimulating hormone uric acid blood pressure and blood sugar you should take the following medicines regularly for one month and after one month you may revert back with investigation reports re kanchanar guggulu one tablet gandamala kanan rasa one tablet gilly ghanvati one tablet thrice a day after meals with lukewarm water punarnavasava 15 my with equal amount of water after meal twice a day alma alovera juice 10 my daily in the morning avoid spicy and fried junk foods drink plenty of lukewarm water regularly avoid milk and milk products egg and non vegetarian foods beans and protein rich food do regular kapalbhati and pranayam like anulom vilom nazi shodhana bhramari and specially ujjai do these things and provide your valuable feedback after one month

STATUS: low severity

================================================================================
Example 2:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: is it possible to get syphilis through kissing

PATIENT: hello doctor I have a question about syphilis I am 29 years old female I am not sexually active but I got engaged recently and my fianc had previous relationships he only kisses me sometimes which I am worried that by kissing some disease might be transferred to me from him I got skin rash on my palms and feet days ago and when I was searching I came across syphilis can syphilis be transmitted through a kiss I went to a doctor and he told me it is a skin virus hfmv and gave me antibiotic cream I did not mention the kissing part to him but he took blood test cop was normal also blood count test was normal I did not mention this to my partner yet I am really worried that it could be some other disease

DOCTOR: hello syphilis cannot be transmitted through kissing it is only transmitted through oral anal and genital sex however syphilis can cause oral ulcers if you kissed someone with an active oral ulcer then the risk of getting syphilis through kissing may occur is there anything else I can help you with or anything that is not clear to you I would gladly clarify them

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
Example 3:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I had a it scan for pelvic pain what does the film indicate

PATIENT: hello doctor my complaint is a pain in the right pelvic area could you suggest what the images of my it film indicate there are some lesions on my bone what do they mean what should be the treatment I am currently on amlodipine valsartan 5 40 my

DOCTOR: hi thanks for writing into us and I have gone through the it scan images there is a lesion in the right intertrochanteric area and is showing characteristics of an osteoma and is almost always a benign condition one must look out for any severe pain and any abnormal bone growth in the area many osteomas might disappear with time and no active treatment is needed in cases when the pain is severe then surgery and bone curettage might help there is a likely area of excess calcium deposition and showing a white spot in the left iliac bone near the left sacroiliac joint area and is called a bone island a bone island is usually not treated however to confirm a bone island and to rule out other lesions a nuclear bone scan can help the thickening of the left anterior pararenal fascia is likely not significant the gall bladder is not well visualized

STATUS: high severity

================================================================================
NOW: Generate a NEW unique medical consultation scenario following the EXACT same format above:

DESCRIPTION: [brief medical question]
PATIENT: [detailed patient narrative]
DOCTOR: [clear, detailed medical advice - write naturally, don't worry about formatting]
STATUS: [low severity / medium severity / high severity]

Generate ONLY the new scenario, no meta-commentary.
api_response:
DESCRIPTION: can high blood pressure cause vision problems

PATIENT: hello doctor I am 58 years old male diagnosed with hypertension five years back currently taking telmisartan 40 mg daily my blood pressure readings are usually around 150/90 mmHg recently I have been experiencing blurred vision especially in my left eye sometimes I see floating spots and have difficulty focusing I also get headaches behind my eyes I visited an optician who said my eye prescription hasn't changed much but referred me to an ophthalmologist I am worried if my high blood pressure is affecting my eyesight should I be concerned about permanent damage

DOCTOR: hello thank you for sharing your concerns yes high blood pressure can definitely affect vision hypertension can damage the tiny blood vessels in the retina causing a condition called hypertensive retinopathy this may lead to blurred vision floating spots or even vision loss if untreated your symptoms align with possible hypertensive eye changes I recommend you see an ophthalmologist urgently for a detailed retinal examination they may perform tests like fundoscopy or optical coherence tomography to assess retinal health meanwhile ensure your blood pressure is well controlled consider lifestyle modifications like reducing salt intake regular exercise and stress management please follow up with your physician to adjust your medication if needed to maintain target blood pressure below 130/80 mmHg

STATUS: medium severity
